Generation IV.Diamond: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
Generation IV.Platinum: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is said that a Wormadam that evolves on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It is said that a Wormadam that evolves on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.

Generation V.Black: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Generation V.White: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Generation V.Black 2: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Generation V.White 2: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.

Generation VI.X: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
Generation VI.Y: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When Burmy evolves, its cloak becomes a part of its body. Wormadam's cloak is never shed.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémon to evade the detection of predators.
